pages.title: Servo Motor
pages.text: Overview $(br2)Efficiently controls two physics structures to maintain a given rotation angle/angular velocity under suitable conditions.$(br)The two motors differ only in rotation direction.
Interaction $(br2)$(li)Sneak + Right Click to assemble blocks above into a physics structure (similar to Clockwork bearings). Glue not supported.$(li)Use a wrench to adjust orientation.

pages.title: Main Panel
pages.text: Right Click with an empty hand to open the control panel.

Main Panel $(br2)Displays basic settings:$(br2)Current: Real-time relative angle/angular velocity (radians/radians per second).$(br2)Locked: Whether the motor is constrained.$(br2)Target: Desired angle/angular velocity.
Both motors at 57Â°. Top: Controlled structure offset. Bottom: Axis offset.
Main Panel $(br2)Offset (First Line): Axis offset for the next assembly.$(br2)Offset (Second Line): Controlled structure's axis offset.
Main Panel $(br2)Mode: Angle or Angular Velocity.$(br2)Cheat:$(li)NO_REPULSE: Disables reaction force.$(li)NO_GRAVITY: Removes gravity.
Main Panel $(br2)AutoLock: Automatically locks the motor when:$(li)Angular Velocity mode: Target is 0.$(li)Angle mode: Error < 1e-3.
Redstone Panel $(br2)Configurable parameters: Output torque, Target value, Lock status. See general redstone panel documentation.
PID Panel $(br2)Output torque formula: (P*error + D*error_rate + I*error_integral) * moment of inertia.$(br)Do not adjust if unfamiliar with PID tuning.
